meanings.definition: Roughness or harshness in texture or appearance.
meanings.sent1: The scabrousness of the tree bark made it difficult to climb.
meanings.sent2: The scabrousness of the sandpaper left my hands feeling rough.
meanings.sent3: Despite its scabrousness, the old blanket was still warm and comforting.
meanings.sent4: The scabrousness of the road reflected the challenges of the journey ahead.
meanings.sent5: The scabrousness of the rock surface warned climbers of its sharp edges.

meanings.definition: Coarseness or crudeness in speech or behavior.
meanings.sent1: The scabrousness of his language offended many at the meeting.
meanings.sent2: Her scabrousness in social settings often led to awkward situations.
meanings.sent3: Despite his scabrousness, he had a heart of gold and always helped others.
meanings.sent4: The scabrousness of his jokes made everyone cringe at the party.
meanings.sent5: The scabrousness of his behavior was a barrier to forming meaningful relationships.
